result.execSummary:
The defendant Mickale Alonso Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentence now serving. Concurrent with 15CF635

superMiscConds.notes: $518 DOC Collect;  If E.S. is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentence now serving, Concurrent with 15CF635
